Package org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.app

Class AbstractApplication<OS extends OperatingSystem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.app.AbstractApplication<OS>
  • Type Parameters:
    OS - type of the operating system for the application.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Application, OperatingSystemAccess<OS>, EventProcessor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdditionalProcessingApp, AdditionalReceivingApp, CamSendingApp, ConfigurableApplication, EventProcessingApp, EventSendingApp, HelloWorldApp, HighwayManagementApp, InterconnectApp, IntervalSamplingApp, MosaicInteractionHandlingApp, MultithreadSamplingApp, NotProcessingApp, OnVehicleUpdatedApp, PerceptionApp, RandomSamplingIntervalApp, RoadSideUnitApp, SimpleCommuterApp, SlowDownApp, SpecificEventProcessingApp, SumoTraciInteractionApp, TrafficLightApp, TrafficLightControlApp, UserTaggedValueReadingApp, VehicleToTrafficLightApp, WeatherServerApp, WeatherWarningApp
    public abstract class AbstractApplication<OS extends OperatingSystem>
extends Object
implements EventProcessor, Application, OperatingSystemAccess<OS>
    The AbstractApplication. Each simulated application must extend this class.

      • getOperatingSystem

        public final OS getOperatingSystem()
        Returns the operating system for this application. Additionally, the operatingSystem is checked against null.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the operating system.

      • setUp

        public final void setUp​(OperatingSystem operatingSystem,
                        UnitLogger log)
        Do not invoke this method in an application. Only the simulation unit should invoke this method.
        Parameters:
        operatingSystem - the operating system reference.
        log - the logger.

      • tearDown

        public final void tearDown()
        Do not invoke this method in an application. Only the unit simulator should invoke this method.

      • isTornDown

        protected final boolean isTornDown()
        Indicates an application was successfully tear down.
        Returns:
        true if success, otherwise false.

      • isValidStateAndLog

        public final boolean isValidStateAndLog()
        This method logs and returns the state of the application.
        Returns:
        true if the application was set up and is not torn down. Otherwise, it returns false.

      • canProcessEvent

        public boolean canProcessEvent()
        Checks whether the application is set up and not torn down.

        This method is used by the event scheduler (DefaultEventScheduler) to determine the correct state of an application, before events are passed to the application (you do not want to process events in an application, which is not properly set up or has already been torn down).

        Specified by:
        canProcessEvent in interface EventProcessor
        Returns:
        true if this EventProcessor is currently able to process events, otherwise false.
